meta.name: Arkham Incidents
meta.description: A set of five Arkham-based side-scenarios, each focusing on and synergizing with an existing ally card from a different class.
meta.author: The Beard
meta.banner_credit: T. Jedruszek, J. Cairós, S. Winters, J.L. Johnson, A. Folny, C. Boyer

cards.name: Too Noble
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: --X.  X is 1 more than the number of [[Evidence]] cards next to the act deck.
[cultist]: --2.  If there is an uncontrolled asset at your location, lose 1 resource.
[tablet]: --3.  If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: --3.  If this is an attack or evade attempt against a [[Monster]] enemy, this test automatically fails instead.

cards.name: Too Noble
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: --X.  X is 2 more than the number of [[Evidence]] cards next to the act deck.
[cultist]: --3.  If there is an uncontrolled asset at your location, lose 1 resource.
[tablet]: --4.  If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: --4.  If this is an attack or evade attempt against a [[Monster]] enemy, this test automatically fails instead.

cards.flavor: A thick tension hangs in the air as you step into the police station.  Whoever the true culprit is, they must know that Tetsuo brought you here to help unmask them.
cards.name: The Night Shift
Jailbreak!
cards.text:
The heavy reverberation of an iron lock echoes throughout the station, followed by a growing tumult of voices. The criminals locked up in the station's holding cells have been let loose. You can safely assume the traitor is responsible for this somehow, and freed the prisoners to both distract the police and slow you down.
Shuffle each set aside [[Criminal]] enemy and treachery into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Mobsters and thugs rampage throughout the station, attacking indiscriminately as they make their escape.  The few officers on duty at the moment do their best to stymie the flow of violence -- including the traitor, keeping up appearances.
cards.name: Violent Assault
cards.text: [free] During a test on or against a [[Criminal]] card, exhaust an uncontrolled asset at your location: You get +2 skill value for this test.

cards.name: Bid for Freedom
cards.text:
The police are being quickly overrun, and the violent gang turns its attention toward you. If you weren't already enemies with the O'Bannions and Sheldon Gang, you certainly are for the time being.
Exhaust each uncontrolled [[Police]] asset in play. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Criminal]] enemy and spawn it engaged with the lead investigator. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.

cards.flavor: The police resistance against the prisoner revolt is waning.  If the station is overrun, you may be forced to flee, and lose the culprit's trail in the process.
cards.name: Last Resistance
cards.text: [free] During a test on or against a [[Criminal]] card, exhaust an uncontrolled asset at your location: You get +1 skill value for this test.

cards.name: Whether 'Tis Nobler
cards.text:
If it is Act 1 or 2:
Tetsuo grabs you by the arm and hustles you out the door, just ahead of the mob of criminals. Now faced with the choice of bludgeoning you senseless or escaping into the night, the escapees decide to make a run for it before backup arrives.
(→R1)
Otherwise:
The true culprit has overwhelmed you without delay and without mercy. Its mass grows, tentacles and teeth all advancing with frightening speed.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: Tetsuo gives you a grim look as you enter the building.  "The body is still in the morgue -- the parts of it that were left behind, at least.  Once you have seen that, we can investigate further."
cards.name: Scene of the Aftermath
cards.text: Objective - If an investigator enters Police Morgue, immediately advance.

cards.name: Autopsy Report
cards.text: You quickly see that Tetsuo's description of the body was no exaggeration. The victim -- a blonde middle-aged man -- is missing various parts of his face, torso, and limbs, all fresh wounds that look as if the body parts were torn away rather than cut. The man's face and torso bear several marks from being dug into or crushed, presumably from the body being held while the limbs were removed. Tetsuo looks to you with his concern clear. No human could have done this. If one of the officers is responsible, then they are either harboring -- or are empowered by -- some dark power.

cards.flavor: Your task is clear, all that remains is to do it.  You must scour the station for any remnants of the body that you can find, and hopefully discover anything the culprit left behind that could identify them.
cards.name: Process of Elimination
cards.text: [free] If there is an [[Evidence]] card beneath your location, spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip that card and move it next to the act deck. Objective - At the end of the round, investigators may as a group decide which officer to accuse and advance. (Hint: If there are 4 pieces of evidence next to the act deck, you have all the information you need. Additional clues will not benefit you.)

cards.name: Fox in the Henhouse
cards.text:
The time has come for the unmasking. Whether or not you guessed correctly, the culprit has decided that now is the only time to strike. A change sweeps over one of the officers, their skin growing red and bulbous, their eyes glowing yellow, and tentacles beginning to snake out from under their clothes.
Look at the [[Evidence]] card beneath the scenario card. If that card is... -...Black Hair, flip Frank Cagle to his enemy side. -...Cigarette Ash, flip Wendell Boone to his enemy side. -...Blue Fabric, flip Jim Fletcher to his enemy side. -...Ink Stain, flip Gus Odell to his enemy side. -...Embedded Bullet, flip Eddie Maguire to his enemy side. Move each [[Evidence]] card beneath a location next to the act deck. For each [[Evidence]] card moved, choose an uncontrolled asset and move it beneath the agenda deck. If the investigators did not guess correctly, ready that enemy and move it to the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Add 1[per_investigator] clues to Reception, Officers' Lounge, Holding Cells, and Police Morgue.

cards.flavor: The monster has emerged, but Tetsuo still looks upon his former colleague with pity.  "Can there be a way to undo this transformation?  Until I know if they did this to themselves willingly, I must try to save them from this horror."
cards.name: The Line of Duty
cards.text: [free] Investigators at your location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move an uncontrolled asset at your location beneath the act deck. [reaction] When an uncontrolled asset at your location would be moved beneath the agenda deck, take 1 damage and 1 horror: Cancel that move. Objective - If there are 4 assets beneath the act deck, advance.

cards.name: Above and Beyond
cards.text:
You and Tetsuo both do what you can to evacuate the police officers, stalling for time while keeping yourself from harming the transformed officer too much. As you evacuate the last of the officers, the horrid creature falters, as if fighting itself. The flesh twists horribly, but a semblance of the officer's face can be seen through the abominable mass at last. "The... nail...! Quick...ly...!" a garbled voice calls out. The mass pulls apart, and you can see the back of the officer's head, with a glowing iron nail embedded at the base. Tetsuo grapples with the creature while you leap forward, seizing the nail and pulling on it with all your strength. With a sickening pop, the nail slips loose, and a tremendous roar reverberates throughout the station.
Move the (Abominable Host) enemy in play to the victory display. (→R4)

cards.flavor: Much of the evidence is delicate or kept in small glass vials.  You will have to be a little careful if you don't want to accidentally destroy any potential clues.
cards.name: Evidence Room
cards.text: Each investigator cannot discover more than 1 clue from Evidence Room each round.

cards.flavor: The station's evidence room is filled with the remains of various unsolved cases and forgotten mysteries, many intentionally abandoned by the overworked police force.
cards.name: Evidence Room

cards.flavor: Any possible evidence here will be found in the oily cabinets, toolboxes, and spare part piles scattered around the garage.  Getting down and dirty is your only option.
cards.name: Garage
cards.text: Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Garage: Lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor: This garage holds the squad cars, motorcycles, and paddy wagons that the force uses in their day to day operations.  Most of them are fully washed and fueled by now.
cards.name: Garage

cards.flavor: Despite the amount of criminals locked up, there are still a few open cells that you could make use of in a pinch.
cards.name: Holding Cells
cards.text: [reaction] After you evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at Holding Cells: That enemy cannot ready until the end of the round. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The police lockup is packed tonight, holding everything from felons awaiting trial to drunks picked up on their way home from hidden speakeasies.
cards.name: Holding Cells

cards.flavor: If anyone's willing to talk, there's no better place to do it.
cards.name: Interview Room
cards.text: [reaction] When your turn begins, if you are at Interview Room: Take a parley action.

cards.flavor: The only difference between an interview and an interrogation is how hands-on you get.
cards.name: Interview Room

cards.flavor: The police don't appreciate outsiders doing their job, but if you can spin it as helping an officer in their official investigation, then things may go a little more smoothly.
cards.name: Officers' Lounge
cards.text: While an investigator at Officers' Lounge controls a [[Police]] investigator or [[Police Ally]] asset, it gets -3 shroud.

cards.flavor: Whether on duty or off duty, many of the officers congregate in this side of the building for work and idle chit-chat.
cards.name: Officers' Lounge

cards.flavor: The disappearances and gang violence often keep the morgue fully packed, but tonight there is but a single body to see.
cards.name: Police Morgue
cards.text: [free] During a test you are performing at Police Morgue: Commit a non-weakness card from your discard pile to this test.  After this test resolves, remove that card from the game.

cards.flavor:
The morgue is a cold and lonely place,
like a cemetery with none of the tasteful decoration.
cards.name: Police Morgue

cards.flavor: At night, this center of activity is almost silent but for the occasional flutter of paper or telephone ring.
cards.name: Reception
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You're in no condition to continue this investigation.

cards.flavor: Tetsuo leads you up the steps of the precinct building and through the double doors.  The desk sergeant looks up to you only briefly before returning to his crossword puzzle.
cards.name: Reception

cards.flavor:
There are months worth of papers to sift through here.
Once you get some indication of what to look for,
you can narrow your search a little.
cards.name: Records Room
cards.text: Records Room gets -X shroud where X is the number of [[Evidence]] cards next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: The records room is lined with filing cabinets and stacked with boxes of papers, dossiers, photos, and anything else that the police could cram in.
cards.name: Records Room

cards.flavor: Sheriff Engle isn't much for paperwork, which unfortunately makes searching his office a rather taxing chore.
cards.name: Sheriff's Office
cards.text: Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Sheriff's Office: Choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Sheriff Engle has already gone home for the day, but his office is still unlocked due to the deputies on duty.
cards.name: Sheriff's Office
Command Essence
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When an asset with health and/or sanity would enter your discard pile, exhaust Command Essence and spend 1 charge: Return that card to your hand instead.

cards.flavor: You nearly miss it, but in this small patch of carnage, there is a single black hair on what is left of the victim's face.  This would be unremarkable if not for the fact that the victim was blonde.  A hair like this would easily have been swept away or lost when transferring the body, which must mean that the hair belongs to whoever dismembered the body.
cards.name: Black Hair

cards.flavor: On the ground beside this grisly part of the victim, you find scattered ashes from a cigarette.  There's no way that these ashes could have come from the deceased, which means that the culprit must have left them by mistake.  The vast majority of police officers smoke frequently as some of the only relief they get from enforcing law in this haunted town.
cards.name: Cigarette Ash

cards.flavor: Mixed in with the carnage in this spot, you find a small torn patch of blue fabric caught by a protruding bone.  The cloth's color and texture match the type used in police uniforms, and since the victim was wearing only black and white, this must have come from the uniform of the officer responsible.
cards.name: Blue Fabric

cards.flavor: You spot a glint of metal inside one of the lumps of gore and pry it open to find a spent bullet.  Its caliber matches the ammo used in police handguns, and still holds a new shine.  The bullet wound was known when the body was brought in, but it now appears that the body's discovery was no accident.  The officer responsible for mutilating the body must have committed the murder in the first place.
cards.name: Embedded Bullet

cards.flavor: Your eye is drawn to a dark stain on white cloth amid a mangled mass of gore.  You touch the spot tentatively and are find it to be ink -- still not completely dry, at that.  This fresh stain could only have happened after the body was brought to the station, which means it must have come from one of the pens that the officers frequently use on duty.
cards.name: Ink Stain
Inscribed Nail
cards.text: [reaction] When you would search your deck or discard pile for any amount of cards, exhaust Inscribed Nail: Search 2 additional cards.  Before resolving the search, either place a non-weakness card among the searched cards from your deck on the top of your discard pile, or vice versa.  Shuffle your deck after the search resolves.

cards.flavor: Deputy Boone sits lazily, legs stretched out in front of him as he sizes you up.  His stare is only interrupted when he turns to spit his wad of chewing tobacco into the garbage bin, though he immediately bites off another chaw to replace it.
cards.name: Wendell Boone
Wendell Boone
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Wendell Boone gets +2[per_investigator] health for each card beneath the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Wendell Boone is ready: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy at its location and move each uncontrolled asset at its location beneath the agenda deck. Then, if there are no uncontrolled assets at its location, move Wendell Boone one location towards the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Objective - If Wendell Boone is defeated, (→R3).

cards.flavor: Detective Fletcher looks up as if caught in the act, but is merely laying out files and photos on the desk of the interview room.  The plainclothes detective seems to take some personal offense at being subject of an investigation for a change.
cards.name: Jim Fletcher
Jim Fletcher
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Jim Fletcher gets +2[per_investigator] health for each card beneath the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Jim Fletcher is ready: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy at its location and move each uncontrolled asset at its location beneath the agenda deck. Then, if there are no uncontrolled assets at its location, move Jim Fletcher one location towards the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Objective - If Jim Fletcher is defeated, (→R3).

cards.flavor: Officer Cagle acts as if he's not watching you, but you can see his eyes reflected in the rear view mirror of the squad car he's buffing.  He scratches his clean-shaven head idly, wiping off a bead of sweat before doubling down on his cleaning duties.
cards.name: Frank Cagle
Frank Cagle
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Frank Cagle gets +2[per_investigator] health for each card beneath the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Frank Cagle is ready: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy at its location and move each uncontrolled asset at its location beneath the agenda deck. Then, if there are no uncontrolled assets at its location, move Frank Cagle one location towards the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Objective - If Frank Cagle is defeated, (→R3).

cards.flavor: Officer Odell glances between you and the printed tag attached to the bottle on the evidence room shelf.  You can tell from the lack of understanding clear on his face that he never learned to read or write, but a man of action and experience still has a place in the police.
cards.name: Gus Odell
Gus Odell
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Gus Odell gets +2[per_investigator] health for each card beneath the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Gus Odell is ready: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy at its location and move each uncontrolled asset at its location beneath the agenda deck. Then, if there are no uncontrolled assets at its location, move Gus Odell one location towards the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Objective - If Gus Odell is defeated, (→R3).

cards.flavor: Eddie gives you an annoyed leer as he looks up from the filing cabinets.  He clearly resents the clerical work, but until he completes his training and earns his gun, it's the only work he's likely to get assigned.
cards.name: Eddie Maguire
Eddie Maguire
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Eddie Maguire gets +2[per_investigator] health for each card beneath the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Eddie Maguire is ready: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy at its location and move each uncontrolled asset at its location beneath the agenda deck. Then, if there are no uncontrolled assets at its location, move Eddie Maguire one location towards the nearest location with an uncontrolled asset. Objective - If Eddie Maguire is defeated, (→R3).

cards.name: "Gimme that!"
cards.text: Revelation - You must (choose one): - Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Criminal]]enemy, spawn it engaged with you, and it makes an immediateattack. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched. - Attach "Gimme that!" and a [[Weapon]] asset you control to a[[Criminal]] enemy in play. Attached enemy gets +1 fight andgains retaliate. Forced - When the attached enemy is evaded or defeated: Discard "Gimme that!" and return each [[Weapon]] asset attached to that enemy to its owner's play area (or discard it if there are no available slots).

cards.name: O'Bannion Gunman
cards.text: Hunter. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Automatically evade O'Bannion Gunman.

cards.name: Running Riot
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty if there are no [[Police]] investigators or [[Police]] assets at your location. This test gains peril if there is a [[Criminal]] enemy at your location. If you fail, take 1 damage and lose a resource. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 additional damage or lose 1 additional resource (choose one).

cards.name: Sheldon Moonshiner
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - After Sheldon Moonshiner attacks you: Exhaust an [[Item]] asset you control. If you cannot, choose an discard an [[Item]] asset you control instead.

cards.name: "You ain't lockin' me up!"
cards.text: Revelation - Put "You ain't lockin' me up!" into play in your threat area. Forced - When a [[Criminal]] enemy engages you: Lose 1 action or that enemy makes an immediate attack (choose one). [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard "You ain't lockin' me up!"

cards.name: Distrust
cards.text: Revelation - If there are fewer than 4 [[Evidence]] cards next to the act deck, put Distrust into play in your threat area. Otherwise, it gains surge. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there is an uncontrolled asset at your location: Take 1 horror. [reaction] After an [[Evidence]] card is moved next to the act deck: Discard Distrust.

cards.name: Disturbing Find
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Disturbing Find to the location with the most clues that does not have a copy of Disturbing Find attached. Forced - When an investigator would discover any amount of clues from the attached location: That investigator takes 1 horror or loses 1 action (choose one). Discard Disturbing Find.

cards.name: Red Tape
cards.text: Revelation - If there are fewer than 4 [[Evidence]] cards next to the act deck, put Red Tape into play next to the agenda deck. Otherwise, it gains surge. Investigators cannot spend clues. [action] If there is an uncontrolled asset at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you control a [[Police]] investigator or [[Police Ally]] asset, you get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, discard Red Tape.

cards.name: Rising Tension
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [[Evidence]] card next to the act deck. If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random. If you fail by 2 or more, discard an additional card from your hand at random.

cards.flavor: Why did it have to be tentacles?!
cards.name: Slithering Tendril
cards.text:
Hunter.
While you are engaged with Slithering Tendril, each [action] ability on a card you control costs 1 additional action.

cards.name: Subtle Stalking
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage or choose and discard an asset from your hand (choose one).

cards.name: Tampered Evidence
cards.text: Revelation - If you do not control any clues, Tampered Evidence gains surge. Otherwise, you must (choose one): - Place 1 of your clues on your location. - Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, place 2 of yourclues on your location.

cards.flavor: What a night to get locked up in the drunk tank.
cards.name: Desperate Vagrant
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you control a [[Police]] investigator or [[Police Ally]] asset, you get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, discard Desperate Vagrant. Forced - After you attack Desperate Vagrant: Lose 1 action.

cards.name: Something Big
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X.  X is 1 less than the number of locations with clues on them (minimum 1).
[cultist]: -3.  If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -2.  -4 instead if you are at an [[Extradimensional]] location.
[elder_thing]: -4.  If you are engaged with an [[Extradimensional]] enemy, take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one).

cards.name: Something Big
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is the number of locations with clues on them (minimum 1).
[cultist]: -4.  If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -3.  -5 instead if you are at an [[Extradimensional]] location.
[elder_thing]: -5.  If you are engaged with an [[Extradimensional]] enemy, take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one).

cards.flavor: The physicist's machine hums to life gradually, and you feel the hairs on the back of your neck stand up as a strange atmosphere spreads over the science building.  Dr. Maleson nods excitedly as he checks one of the machine's gauges.  "Go on, quickly now!  Prepare the nearby halls for the next phase while the power is holding steady!  The process is simple, so just follow my notes!  And be sure to calibrate the conduits evenly!"
cards.name: Starting Sequence
Feedback Loop
cards.text:
The lights in the science building all dim at once as a power surge flows through the cables. The steady hum from Dr. Maleson's machine goes suddenly wild as the conduits throughout the building flash and shudder. Dr. Maleson talks to himself tensely under his breath as he adjusts the machine's dials. "No no no no, don't do that..."
Attach this card to Dr. Maleson's Lab. Each location gets +2 shroud value. Dr. Maleson's Lab gains "[action]: You attempt to fix the machine. Test [intellect] (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. You may exhaust a [[Miskatonic]] asset at your location to get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, remove an agenda card attached to Dr. Maleson's Lab."

cards.flavor: The machine rattles and shakes with increasing intensity as the experiment continues.  "It... should hold," Dr. Maleson says, uncertainty plain in his voice, "though I can't say for how long.  That only means we have to work faster!  No amount of data will be of use if my machine doesn't survive to use it!"
cards.name: Degeneration
Structure Compromised
cards.text:
The audible snap of shearing metal rings out, and several rivets burst out of their sockets from the pressure overload. Dr. Maleson scrambles to clamp the loose parts back together, but the fixes won't stop the inevitable breakdown.
Attach this card to Dr. Maleson's Lab. As an additional cost to discover a clue from or place a clue on any location, you must choose and discard a card from your hand. Dr. Maleson's Lab gains "[action]: You attempt to fix the machine. Test [intellect] (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. You may exhaust a [[Miskatonic]] asset at your location to get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, remove an agenda card attached to Dr. Maleson's Lab."

cards.flavor: With the rapidly failing state of Dr. Maleson's machine, you hope it doesn't explode, or any number of other worse outcomes.  You block out the fatalistic thoughts and focus on trying to end the experiment before it all goes up in smoke.
cards.name: Breaking Point
Critical Failure
cards.text:
If it is Act 1 or 2:
The gauges spike up to dangerous levels while emergency braces snap and the machine's anchor points shift. You rush back to Dr. Maleson's lab in time to see the total collapse of the entire device.
(→R1)
Otherwise:
The machinery sparks and smokes furiously as the alien creature prevents your best efforts at shutting down Dr. Maleson's machine. The geometric monstrosity draws energy from the machine into itself, causing surge after surge which finally explodes outward.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: Dr. Maleson's notes are certainly thorough, but hardly clear or organized.  You try to make sense of his scientific jargon as you follow cabling that snakes out from his lab deeper into the science building.
cards.name: Impractical Applications
cards.text: [reaction] When you would discover any amount of clues from a [[Reactive]] location, even if there are no clues on that location: Instead, move that many clues controlled by investigators at your location to that location. Objective - If each clue in play is on a [[Reactive]] location, advance.

cards.name: Folded Space
cards.text:
You've checked and re-checked Dr. Maleson's data, but something isn't quite adding up. A completely even calibration across the conduits doesn't seem possible, contrary to his claims. Either this level of physics really is beyond you, or there's been a miscalculation. Hoping for the former, you inform Dr. Maleson to proceed if he's ready. The scientist rubs his hands together excitedly and throws the main breaker on his machine. The air around you vibrates and ripples, accompanied by a noise like radio static. And then through tiny patches in the air, you begin to see an unfamiliar world.
Shuffle each of the set aside Alien Landscape locations together and randomly place one into each corner of the map (so each is adjacent to two [[Reactive]] locations). Remove the other two Alien Landscape locations from the game. Move each clue on a [[Reactive]] location to the Alien Landscape location in the clockwise direction from that location. If there are 1[per_investigator] or fewer clues on any Alien Landscape location, add clues to it until there are 1[per_investigator] + 1 clues on it. Put the set-aside Variable Frequencies story card into play next to the Frequency Deck. Draw the top card of the Frequency Deck and put it into play next to the Variable Frequencies story card.

cards.flavor: Dr. Maleson checks several gauges with increasing concern as the phenomenon continues.  "No, no, this isn't quite right... is it something on the other side?  It must be!  It's the only explanation!"  He turns to you, scribbling new calculations onto a scratch pad.  "This overlap won't last long unless we stabilize it.  And the only way to do that is to venture into this new world and figure out the frequency differences!"
cards.name: First Excursion
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Unstable]] locations in play, advance.

cards.name: Not Gone Unnoticed
cards.text:
You scour the alien world for any signs of disturbance that could disrupt Dr. Maleson's experiment. It's hard to discern what's out of place on a completely unknown planet, but one thing catches your eye. Several red cubes float throughout the landscape, glowing faintly and unaffected by the distortions. You reach out to touch one, and it suddenly goes dark, falling to the ground with a hollow clatter, followed by a smoothing out of the static around you. You repeat this with each cube you find, and steadily the stilted world grows more stable. "Whatever you're doing, keep doing it!" Dr. Maleson cheers, "I'm gaining more control over the fluctuations now! Just a-" His statement is cut off as the deactivated cubes suddenly spike with energy, and a massive wave of distortion sweeps out from his lab.
Spawn the set-aside Convergent Entity at Dr. Maleson's Lab.

cards.flavor: Dr. Maleson's lab has been invaded by a geometric being -- not wild and brutal like the aliens you've staved off so far, but moving with deliberate intelligence and draining power from the machine.  "This has gone far enough!" Dr. Maleson cries, backing clumsily away from the entity, "Activate the failsafes, quickly!"
cards.name: Unexpected Catalyst
cards.text: Dr. Maleson's Lab gains the [[Extradimensional]] trait. [action] If you are at Dr. Maleson's Lab: Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, an investigator at your location may place 1 of his or her clues on your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, that investigator may place 1 additional clue. If there is at least 3[per_investigator] damage on Convergent Entity, you get +2 [intellect] for this test and this action does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Objective - If there are at least 3[per_investigator] clues on Dr. Maleson's Lab, advance.

cards.name: Proof of Concept
cards.text:
The looming entity actively tries to prevent you from shutting down Dr. Maleson's machine for reasons you can only guess. In spite of its interference, you figure out the proper sequence for an emergency shutdown and rush to execute it. The electrical coils shut off abruptly, and for one extended moment, the geometric alien suspends in midair before you. With a grating and unnatural sound, it scatters apart, dissolving back through dimensions and leaving the lab in stark silence.
Move Convergent Entity to the victory display. (→R4)

cards.name: Alien Landscape

cards.flavor:
Dr. Milan Christopher is rarely found in his office.
He seems to do more fieldwork than the rest of
Miskatonic's staff combined.
cards.name: Dr. Christopher's Office
cards.text: [reaction] After you defeat a [[Monster]] enemy at Dr. Christopher's Office: Gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
With the broad scope of Miskatonic's science programs, many of the more niche specialties -- like entomology --
get lumped together at the far end of the building.
cards.name: Dr. Christopher's Office

cards.flavor: You have no clue what any of the large machines in Dr. Maleson's lab do, but since they all eventually connect to the central machine, you assume that they must be important.
cards.name: Dr. Maleson's Lab
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "Shut this thing off before the entire Science Building goes up in smoke."

cards.flavor: Though Dr. Maleson is technically part of the physics department, few people can say what his actual specialty is.
cards.name: Dr. Maleson's Lab

cards.flavor:
The steady hum of machinery soon fades into
background noise as you enter the reinforced room.
cards.name: Generator Room
cards.text: Generator Room gets -1 shroud for each other [[Reactive]] location with more clues on it than Generator Room.

cards.flavor: With all the electrical equipment being run, tested, and fixed on the fly, Miskatonic made the decision long ago to run the science building separately from the city's power grid.
cards.name: Generator Room

cards.flavor:
After hours, the size and emptiness of the room
lend an eerie feeling to the lecture hall.
cards.name: Lecture Hall
cards.text: [reaction] When you draw cards during upkeep, draw 1 additional card.  Choose a non-weakness card and place it on the bottom of your deck.

cards.flavor:
One of the many classrooms for science students,
shared among the equally many professors and subjects.
cards.name: Lecture Hall

cards.flavor:
Tools and spare material lie about the room in heaps,
some grouped together for halfway-finished projects.
cards.name: Machine Shop
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Machine Shop: Reduce the cost of the next [[Item]] asset you play this round by 1.

cards.flavor:
For the students of engineering and any others
who need physical machines for their work,
the campus machine shop is ready and waiting.
cards.name: Machine Shop
Dimensional Inductor
cards.text:
Uses (4 secrets).
[action] Exhaust Dimensional Inductor: Discard the top card of the encounter deck.
[reaction] After you discard or shuffle an encounter card back into the encounter deck via a player effect, spend 1 secret: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck and discard each card with the same name as that encounter card.  Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The frequency shifts smoothly, and the landscape that bleeds into view is quiet, almost serene for the moment.
cards.name: Placid Frequency

cards.flavor: You are hemmed in by dense masses of alien plants as the frequency shifts, and the threat of stalking predators nearby.
cards.name: Tangled Frequency
cards.text:
Each enemy at an [[Extradimensional]] location gets +1 evade and +1 horror.
Increase the cost of each event played at an [[Extradimensional]] location by 1.

cards.flavor: The frequency settles on a primordial landscape filled with all manner of brutal creatures fighting for survival.
cards.name: Savage Frequency
cards.text:
Each enemy at an [[Extradimensional]] location gets +1 fight and +1 damage.
Investigators at [[Extradimensional]] locations cannot ready cards they control.

cards.flavor: You feel the ground beneath you grow unsteady with this frequency shift, and several pieces of terrain float away.
cards.name: Disorienting Frequency
cards.text:
When an investigator would move from an [[Extradimensional]] location, it costs 1 additional action.
Investigators at [[Extradimensional]] locations cannot gain resources during their turn.

cards.flavor: Cascading colors and bright flashes of light assault your mind as the frequency shifts to a churning and vibrant dimension.
cards.name: Strobing Frequency
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at an [[Extradimensional]] location takes 1 horror. Investigators at [[Extradimensional]] locations cannot draw cards during their turn.

cards.flavor: A poisonous atmosphere assaults you as the frequency shifts, springing from pits of caustic liquid across the landscape.
cards.name: Toxic Frequency
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at an [[Extradimensional]] location takes 1 damage. Increase the cost of each asset played at an [[Extradimensional]] location by 1.

cards.flavor: As the frequency shifts violently, states of matter begin to mix in a spectacular and uncontrollable maelstrom.
cards.name: Wild Frequency
cards.text: Ignore each Forced effect on an Alien Landscape location which would flip it. Forced - When Wild Frequency enters play, flip each Alien Landscape location to its [[Unstable]] side.

cards.name: Phase Reactance Gauge
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
[reaction] After any amount of clues are moved to or placed on your location, exhaust Phase Reactance Gauge: You get +1 to each of your skills until the end of the round.

cards.name: Anomalous Being
cards.text:
Hunter.
Anomalous Being moves during the enemy phase even if it is exhausted.

cards.name: Chain Reaction
cards.text: Revelation - Put Chain Reaction into play in your threat area. Forced - After you commit a card to a skill test: If the top card of your discard pile has icons matching that test: Take 1 damage or 1 horror. (Limit once per copy of Chain Reaction per test.) [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Chain Reaction.

cards.name: Destabilization
cards.text: Revelation - Put Destabilization into play next to the agenda deck. During each investigator's turn, increase the cost of all cards by 1 for each action taken during that turn. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Destabilization.

cards.name: Dimensional Radiation
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Choose and discard half of the cards in your hand(rounded up). - Lose half of your resources (rounded up). - Perform both of the above options. If only 1 card is discarded or only 1 resource is lost through this effect (but not both), Dimensional Radiation gains surge.

cards.name: Electrical Feedback
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 damage or lose 1 action. If you fail by 2 or more, Electrical Feedback gains surge.

cards.name: Gravity Flux
cards.text: Revelation - Put Gravity Flux into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round, in player order, each investigator takes 1 damage and moves to a connecting location (empty if possibly). Discard Gravity Flux. (Max once per round.) [action] [action]: Discard Gravity Flux.

cards.name: Inhospitable Realm
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and gains peril if you are at an [[Extradimensional]] location. If you fail, choose and discard an asset you control. If you do not control any assets, choose and discard two assets from your hand instead.

cards.name: Miscalculation
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Miscalculation in your threat area, put Miscalculation into play in your threat area. Otherwise it gains surge. You cannot discover clues or activate abilities on the current act. [action] Choose and discard any amount of cards from your hand with X total skill icons, where X is your location's shroud value: Discard Miscalculation.

cards.name: Outer Inhabitant
cards.text: Spawn - Location without investigators ([[Extradimensional]] if possible). Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After an investigator enters Outer Inhabitant's location: It gets +2 fight and -2 evade until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Phase Echo
cards.text: Prey - Investigator with the most clues. Aloof. Hunter. While Phase Echo is unengaged, it cannot be engaged via engage actions or player card effects. Forced - After you discover a clue from or place a clue on Phase Echo's location, if Phase Echo is ready: Phase Echo engages you.

cards.name: Vacuous Leech
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Alert. Vacuous Leech gets +1 health for each resource token on it. Forced - After Vacuous Leech attacks: Place 1 resource token on it from the token bank.

cards.flavor:
In so many other dimensions,
there is only empty space where Earth once stood.
cards.name: Void Breach
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Void Breach to a [[Reactive]] location without a copy of Void Breach attached (without investigators, if possible). Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 doom on Void Breach. [action]: Test [agility] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck. If at least 1 asset is discarded, take 1 damage. If at least 1 event is discarded, take 1 horror. Whether you pass or fail, discard Void Breach.

cards.name: Convergent Entity
cards.text: Massive. Forced - After 3 or more clues are added to Convergent Entity's location in the same turn: Ready Convergent Entity and it cannot be exhausted until the end of that turn. Forced - When an investigator would resign or be defeated: Place each of that investigator's clues on a connecting location. Objective - If Convergent Entity is defeated, (→R3).

cards.name: Variable Frequencies
cards.text:
Dr. Maleson's machine fluctuates constantly, unable to hold a specific frequency for more than a few minutes at a time. The spaces stretching out from the lab shift with each surge of power.
Forced - At the start of the mythos phase, shuffle each [[Frequency]] card in play back into the Frequency Deck. Draw the top card of the Frequency Deck and put it into play next to this story card.

cards.name: Variable Frequencies
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.name: Unscrupulous Investments
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1.  -3 instead if you have fewer than 5 resources.
[cultist]: -2.  If this is a test on a [[Madness]] or [[Pact]] treachery, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -1.  If you fail, lose a resource for each point you fail by.
[elder_thing]: -3.  -5 instead if you do not control any assets with cost 4 or higher.

cards.name: Unscrupulous Investments
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2.  -4 instead if you have fewer than 5 resources.
[cultist]: -3.  If this is a test on a [[Madness]] or [[Pact]] treachery, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -2.  If you fail, lose a resource for each point you fail by.
[elder_thing]: -4.  -6 instead if you do not control any assets with cost 4 or higher.

cards.flavor: You had already noticed on your arrival an atmosphere of suspicion and envy.  People on street corners glanced you up and down while others clutched their wallets and purses a little more tightly.  This is no ordinary tension.
cards.name: Envious Eyes
cards.text: [action] If there are no enemies at your location: Resign. "Best to cut our losses."

cards.name: Price Fixing
cards.text:
The infectious greed sweeping over the district is starting to take effect. On every street, informants insist on a bribe up front, while cab drivers ratchet up their fares as subtly as they can. You'll need someone with good business sense to straighten these opportunists out.
Move this card below the agenda deck. As an additional cost to activate an ability on a location or the current act, pay 1 resource. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). You may exhaust a [[Patron]] asset at your location to get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, remove this card from the game.

cards.flavor: The district is slowly becoming more volatile as the citizens all feel a growing lust for riches.  Is this an effect of being nearby the golden artifact?  The power within it may go unchecked if you don't act quickly.
cards.name: Desperate Times
cards.text: [action] If there are no enemies at your location: Resign. "Best to cut our losses."

cards.name: Profiteering
cards.text:
Tempers begin to flare at the widespread price gouging, but the populace refuses to budge on their ambitions. Their desire for money is driving them now. Only skillful words have any chance of getting them to back down now.
Move this card below the agenda deck. As an additional cost to activate an ability on a location or the current act, pay 1 resource. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). You may exhaust a [[Patron]] asset at your location to get +2 skill value for this test. If you succeed, remove this card from the game.

cards.flavor: The Merchant District is a powder keg ready to blow.  Finishing your work is the only thing that can keep this fuse from burning through.
cards.name: Rampant Greed
cards.text: [action] If there are no enemies at your location: Resign. "Best to cut our losses."

cards.name: All That Glitters
cards.text:
If it is Act 1 or 2:
Tensions finally boil over into fist fights, and soon the entire district has devolved into a full blown riot. As police sirens draw closer, Dario pulls you aside with a frown. "Finding the thief in this melee will be impossible, especially with the police involved. We must unfortunately abandon this task."
(→R1)
Otherwise:
The spirit cackles cruelly as the sounds of violence begin to saturate the district. "Consumed by avarice, as feeble creatures be!" It turns toward you with malice flashing in the eyes across its body, each one peering deep into your soul.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: You step into the streets of the Merchant district with some idea of the thief's identity.  Time is of the essence if you don't want the thief to escape Arkham with the artifact in tow.
cards.name: A Gilded Trail
cards.text: [action] If you are not engaged with any enemies, spend X resources: "Taxi!" Move directly to any location up to X connections away. Forced - When a story card enters the victory display, advance.

cards.name: Caught Gold-Handed
cards.text:
If there are fewer than 3 story cards in the victory display:
You've finally tracked the thief to a dead end -- his, to be exact. Another gold statue lies collapsed in the darkened room, with the artifact nowhere in sight. On the bright side, the man who stole the artifact from the previous thief left some clues to his identity, which you quickly gather.
Draw the top card of the Pursuit Deck and put it into play next to the act deck. Flip back to act 1a.
Otherwise:
You round a corner and spot a glint of gold in the bundle under one man's arm. Your eyes meet and he immediately turns, scrambling away fearfully.
Spawn the set-aside Desperate Thief at the closest [[Crossroad]] location to the lead investigator. Put the set-aside Dead End Alley into play adjacent to the furthest [[Crossroad]] location from the lead investigator.

cards.flavor: "Fine work, my friend!" Dario calls out, close behind you.  "Once he's cornered, I'm sure that you can persuade him to part with the relic.  For his own health."
cards.name: The Chase is On
cards.text: [action] If you are not engaged with any enemies, spend X resources: "Taxi!" Move directly to any location up to X connections away. Objective - When Desperate Thief enters Dead End Alley, advance.

cards.name: Fatal Mistake
cards.text:
Your maneuvering funnels the thief toward a long alleyway in one of the district's cross streets. He rushes frantically forward, realizing too late that you've left him no escape route. The man's panic quickly mounts as one of his legs goes stiff, glints of gold peeking through the gaps in his clothes. Gold sweeps over his skin until with a final cry of despair, he collapses to the ground with a metallic echo. The relic flings out of his stiffened grip and crashes against the bricks at the end of the alley. Wisps of golden smoke rise from the cracks in the artifact. With an inhuman raspy laugh, the smoke takes shape, and a horrid grinning creature manifests before you. Dario raises his cane defensively, taking an apprehensive step back. "Be not afraid..." the demon hisses, "I can grant thee such riches as thou never have dreamt of!"
Reveal Dead End Alley. Flip Desperate Thief.

cards.flavor: You stare down the grinning fiend as Dario nervously takes his place beside you.  "Proceed as you will... but if this spirit was imprisoned within that artifact... perhaps it can be imprisoned once more."
cards.name: Risk and Reward
cards.text: [action] If you are not engaged with any enemies, spend X resources: "Taxi!" Move directly to any location up to X connections away. Objective - If investigators at Dead End Alley control 15[per_investigator] or more resources as a group, advance.

cards.name: From Whence It Came
cards.text:
You rebuff the demon time and again, knowing full well the fate of those who succumb to its temptations. As you stave off the spirit, you attempt to piece the artifact back together, using whatever materials you can find to secure it. Piece by piece, you work frantically until the last fragment slots in. A golden light radiates outward, and the entity howls in rage as its body returns to smoke, drawing back into the relic. "A blight upon thee and thy descendents! I will not be--" But silence settles on the alleyway. Dario finds a clean spot to sit and pats his forehead clear of sweat. "Done in timely fashion, my friend. You have certainly earned your commission."
Move The Gilded Spirit to the victory display. (→R4)

cards.flavor: Seedy scroungers and opportunists linger on the fringe of the district, always happy to buy at cut-rate prices.
cards.name: Boundary Street
cards.text: [action] Discard an [[Item]] asset from your hand: Gain a number of resources equal to half of that asset's cost (rounded up). (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: The aptly named Boundary Street forms the western edge of the Merchant District, where brick and mortar buildings quickly transition to undeveloped fields.
cards.name: Boundary Street

cards.flavor: Conversing with Miskatonic's faculty tends to be tedious, though straining your attention may be worth it.
cards.name: Central Church Street
cards.text: [free] During your turn, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Reduce Central Church Street's shroud by 3 until the end of your turn.  (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor: This section of Church Street borders the main quad of the Miskatonic University campus, and is lined with shops that support its staff and students.
cards.name: Central Church Street

cards.flavor: Dario's list of contacts and ample resources will help you get this hunt moving much faster than you could on your own.
cards.name: Central Main Street
cards.text: [reaction] After you play an asset at Central Main Street: Activate an [action] ability on that asset.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Dario's office is situated among several respectable shops, which lend a bit more credence to his dubious work.
cards.name: Central Main Street

cards.flavor:
The crates littering the silent docks could prove useful
if you have the time to sort through their contents.
cards.name: Central River Street
cards.text: [action] Choose and discard two cards from your hand: Choose a card in your discard pile and return it to your hand.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Though busy due to its position in the Merchant District, the central stretch of River Street tends to be quieter, perhaps due to its somber view of the Unvisited Isle in the nearby river.
cards.name: Central River Street

cards.flavor: Cornered doesn't necessarily mean helpless.
cards.name: Dead End Alley
cards.text:
Dead End Alley is connected to the adjacent [[Crossroad]] location, and vice versa.
While you are at Dead End Alley, clues you control count as resources for the purpose of calculating total resources in your resource pool.

cards.flavor: The streets of the Merchant District connect with each other frequently to help potential customers find their way to the various shops.  There are exceptions, of course.
cards.name: Dead End Alley
cards.text: Dead End Alley is connected to the adjacent [[Crossroad]] location, and vice versa.

cards.flavor:
Nothing says you belong in high society
like a wallet or purse filled with cash.
cards.name: East Church Street
cards.text: While you are investigating East Church Street, it gets -1 shroud for every 5 resources in your resource pool when you initiated the action.

cards.flavor: The eastern section of Church Street borders the wealthy French Hill neighborhood, and is appropriately developed for that rich clientele.
cards.name: East Church Street

cards.flavor: There are plenty of gossips out shopping tonight, but they know full well that the best tidbits are worth something.
cards.name: East Main Street
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 clue from the token bank. If you succeed by 2 or more, gain 1 resource. If you fail, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor: The east side of Main Street houses the most utilitarian businesses due to its location near residential areas, such as grocers and small department stores.
cards.name: East Main Street

cards.flavor: The high society snobs that frequent these marinas only rub elbows with the elite, or those with the money to pretend.
cards.name: East River Street
cards.text:
Clues cannot be discovered from East River Street unless you control a [[Patron]] asset.
[free] During your turn, pay 2 resources: Ignore the above text until the end of your turn.

cards.flavor: Due to its proximity to Rivertown and French Hill, this stretch of River Street is used by the wealthier citizens for private marinas.
cards.name: East River Street

cards.flavor: Trucks and vans flow steadily between the Merchant District and the railyard, supplying the nearby businesses.
cards.name: Garrison Street
cards.text: [reaction] After you play an asset: Garrison Street gets -3 shroud until the end of the turn. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor: Garrison Street services much of the business to and from Northside's train depot across the Miskatonic River.
cards.name: Garrison Street

cards.flavor: Between the wealthy businesses on the east end of the district, and the neighborhood on the other side, there's no shortage of odd jobs available to those with the patience for it.
cards.name: Peabody Avenue
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test any skill (4). If you succeed, gain 2 resources. If you succeed by 2 or more, gain 1 additional resource. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: Peabody Avenue is the quietest of the three streets crossing the Miskatonic.  As the road separating the Merchant District from the residential neighborhood of Rivertown, it receives mostly non-business traffic.
cards.name: Peabody Avenue

cards.flavor:
Used and refurbished items are in high demand
with students living on low budgets.
cards.name: West Church Street
cards.text: [free] During your turn, choose and discard an [[Item]] asset you control: Reduce West Church Street's shroud by 3 until the end of your turn.  (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor: West Church Street borders the block dedicated to student dorms for Miskatonic University, and its shops are aimed at students just now gaining independence from their families.
cards.name: West Church Street

cards.flavor: The workers on this end are tough as nails and not much for conversation.  They'll need some convincing to open up.
cards.name: West Main Street
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, gain 1 clue from the token bank. If you succeed by 2 or more, gain 1 resource. If you fail, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor: Far from the high-end shops near Arkham residential areas, Main Street's western end is populated by gashouses, junkyards, and other low-class businesses.
cards.name: West Main Street

cards.flavor:
Local mechanic shops stock every imaginable
piece and part you could ever need.
cards.name: West River Street
cards.text: [action] Spend 1-3 resources: Place X resources on an asset you control that uses supplies or ammo, where X was the amount of resources spent, up to its starting value.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: There are fewer docks on this end of River Street, though plenty of automobile services due to its proximity to the highways in and out of Arkham.
cards.name: West River Street

cards.flavor: Cars and pedestrians alike rush up and down the avenue, going about their business with single-minded purpose.
cards.name: West Street
cards.text: West Street gets -1 shroud for each connecting location that has been revealed.

cards.flavor: Due to its quick connections to the western and northern highways out of Arkham, West Street tends to be one of the busier roads running through the Merchant District.
cards.name: West Street
Gilded Coin
cards.text:
Fast.  Uses (0 rewards).
[reaction] After you resolve an action and gained at least 1 resource during that action, exhaust Gilded Coin: Add 1 reward to Gilded Coin.
[action] Spend X rewards and shuffle Gilded Coin back into your deck: Play a card with cost X or less from your hand at no cost.

cards.name: Midas Touch
cards.text: Uses (4 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. You must use either [willpower] or [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. You get +1 skill value for every 5 resources in your resource pool. If this attack defeats an enemy, you may gain a resource (2 resources instead if the defeated enemy had 3 or more total health).

cards.name: Ambitious Thug
cards.text: Prey - Most resources. Hunter. Retaliate. Ambitious Thug gets +1 fight and +1 damage if the engaged investigator has 5 or more resources. Ambitious Thug gains aloof if there are no investigators at its location with 2 or more resources.

cards.name: Covetous Impulses
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no copies of Covetous Impulses in your threat area, put it into play in your threat area. Otherwise it gains surge. Forced - After you spend any amount of resources: Place those resources on Covetous Impulses instead of returning them to the token bank. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are 3 or more resources on Covetous Impulses: Take 1 horror. If there are 6 or more resources on Covetous Impulses, take 1 additional horror. Whether or not you took horror, remove each resource on Covetous Impulses. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Covetous Impulses.

cards.name: Crooked Informant
cards.text: Spawn - Location without an investigator. Aloof. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Ambitious Thug and spawn it at that investigator's location. If there are no copies of Ambitious Thug in the encounter deck and discard pile, place 1 doom on Crooked Informant instead. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Discard Crooked Informant. You may spend 2 additional resources to discover a clue from any location.

cards.name: Daemon of Temptation
cards.text: Hunter. Daemon of Temptation gets -1 fight and -1 evade for every 5 resources the engaged investigator has (to a minimum of 1). Forced - When an investigator at any location reveals a [skull] token during a test on a [[Madness]] or [[Pact]] treachery: Treat that token as a [elder_thing] token instead.

cards.name: Easy Pickings
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty if you have 5 or more resources, and an additional +1 difficulty if you have 10 or more resources. If you fail, take 1 damage. If you fail by 2 or more, lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Everything for a Price
cards.text: Revelation - Put Everything for a Price into play next to the agenda deck with 3 resources on it. As an additional cost for an investigator to discover any amount of clues, that investigator must pay a number of resources equal to the amount of resources on Everything for a Price. Forced - After an investigator discovers any amount of clues: Discard Everything for a Price. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (1). For each point you succeed by, remove 1 resource from Everything for a Price.

cards.name: Fleeting Quarry
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect maycause the current agenda to advance. - Put Fleeting Quarry into play next to the agenda deck. cards.name: Unreliable Information
cards.text: Revelation - If you do not control any clues, Unreliable Information gains surge. Otherwise, reveal 3 random chaos tokens. If you reveal a [bless] or [curse] token, ignore it and reveal another token. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], and [auto_fail] token you reveal, return 1 clue to your location.

cards.name: Desperate Thief
cards.text: Retaliate. Desperate Thief cannot move or be moved by player effects. Forced - When Desperate Thief would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from him, disengage him from each investigator and move him to a connecting location. [action] Spend 1[per_investigator] clues: Parley. Move Desperate Thief to a connecting location.

cards.name: The Gilded Spirit
cards.text: Massive. The Gilded Spirit cannot be damaged by investigators that have fewer than 5 resources. Investigators not at The Gilded Spirit's location receive 2 fewer resources from each effect outside of the upkeep phase. [action] If The Gilded Spirit is exhausted: Parley. Gain 3 resources and ready The Gilded Spirit. Objective - If The Gilded Spirit is defeated, (→R3).

cards.name: The Sailor
cards.text:
[[River Street.]]
If there's anything clear about the thief, it's that he is a sailor. And not a reputable one at that. Often found gambling or drinking along the riverfront, he wouldn't hesitate to steal to keep his vices fed. If he's still in Arkham, he's likely returned to River Street with his new collateral.
[free] If each [[River Street]] location is revealed, investigators at [[River Street]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.name: The Businessman
cards.text:
[[Main Street.]]
Main Street is filled with all manner of businessmen and entrepreneurs, and not all of them reputable. The thief is one such man, a swindler presenting himself as an honest salesman, and one who would jump at the chance to score something this valuable. He's likely to be found at his own establishment.
[free] If each [[Main Street]] location is revealed, investigators at [[Main Street]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.name: The Student
cards.text:
[[Church Street.]]
Not every student of Miskatonic has a bright future ahead. The thief is a borderline dropout, having neither the talent nor enthusiasm for study, and is more often found trying to take advantage of other students' naivety. He's likely to be found on Church Street, much of which borders the campus.
[free] If each [[Church Street]] location is revealed, investigators at [[Church Street]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.name: The Vagabond
cards.text:
[[West.]]
To say the thief has a bad reputation is an under-statement. Never holding a job longer than a few weeks a time, he drifts from place to place, looking for easy scores and quick opportunities, only working if forced to it. Most days, he can be found loitering on the west side of the Merchant District.
[free] If each [[West]] location is revealed, investigators at [[West]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.name: The Criminal
cards.text:
[[Central.]]
The thief is one of the many criminals drawn to Arkham's boom of organized crime. He fancies himself a manipulator, content to pay others to do his dirty work for him, and attempting to cheat those he does hire. He's often found in the central parts of Merchant District, looking for new marks.
[free] If each [[Central]] location is revealed, investigators at [[Central]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.name: The Socialite
cards.text:
[[East.]]
Not every thief is down on their luck. This thief is one of the supposed elite living in nearby French Hill, but he's resorted to thievery in the past to keep up his lavish lifestyle. Chances are that you'll find him on the east side of the Merchant District, close to his home neighborhood.
[free] If each [[East]] location is revealed, investigators at [[East]] locations spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Move this card to the victory display. Victory 0.

cards.flavor: You arrive at the mouth of Black Cave to find it stark and quiet.  You can already feel your blood racing through your veins.  Are you just nervous, or can their blood magic affect you even up here?
cards.name: The Blood Ceremony
cards.text: Forced - When an enemy attack or encounter card effect deals any amount of damage to you or an [[Ally]] asset you control: Place 1 damage on the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Warded Within
cards.text:
With a sudden flash, bloody sigils smeared on the walls of the cave begin to resonate with power. Olive's eyes trace quickly over the designs and she swallows nervously. "They're warding hexes! Brace your mind for a shock!"
In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] (4). Before any tests are made, any one investigator may exhaust a [[Witch]] asset they control to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for each investigator. Each investigator who fails loses 1 action and takes 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The atmosphere grows steadily more tense as the sorcerers continue building their dark ceremony.  You can already feel a tightness in your veins from their amplifying blood magic.
cards.name: Dark Flow
cards.text: Forced - When an enemy attack or encounter card effect deals any amount of damage to you or an [[Ally]] asset you control: Place 1 damage on the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Torrent of Blood
cards.text:
A sudden thundering echoes through the cave as a wall of blood surges toward you like a river rapids. You search for an alcove to brace yourself in as Olive quickly racks her brain for any magic that can slow the tidal wave.
In player order, each investigator tests [agility] (4). Before any tests are made, any one investigator may exhaust a [[Witch]] asset they control to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for each investigator. Each investigator who fails loses 1 action and takes 1 damage.

cards.flavor: Your blood roils inside you as you press on to stop the sorcerers' ritual.  Is there still time enough to quash the spell?
cards.name: Hour of Crimson
cards.text: Forced - When an enemy attack or encounter card effect deals any amount of damage to you or an [[Ally]] asset you control: Place 1 damage on the scenario reference card.

cards.name: Profane Triumph
cards.text:
If it is Act 1 or 2:
The power from deeper in the caverns explodes outward in torrents that overwhelm your senses. Olive braces herself against the cave wall, eyes wide with instinctive fear. "We've got to get out of here. Now!"
(→R1)
Otherwise:
The lesser sorcerers scattered around the pool of blood raise their voices in one final verse, and the red glow shines blindingly bright. A sudden silence sweeps over the cavern as the chanting abruptly stops, until their leader laughs darkly. "At last... the power is mine!" He looks to you, malice still apparent through the smile. "Now, interlopers, witness my wrath!"
(→R2)

cards.flavor: The task of rooting out the sorcerers will not be simple.  Black Cave is a labyrinth of interconnecting passages, and each attempt by scholars to map it out has inevitably failed.  You will have to go in blind to find the site of their ceremony.
cards.name: Spelunking
cards.text: Objective - If there are 6 or more revealed copies of Dark Recesses, advance.

cards.name: Light at the End
cards.text:
Slowly you gain a vague familiarity with the twisted passages of Black Cave, noting each convergence and divergence mentally. Through trial and error, you uncover the paths the sorcerers themselves have most recently used, leading to yet deeper sections of the cave.
Put the set-aside Pool of Blood location into play.

cards.flavor: Down the furthest tunnels from the entrance, a faint red glow emanates dimly up at you.  "That's definitely the way," Olive states with an uneasy shift, "I can feel the concentration of magic there strongest.  They're down there, and their leader will be waiting."
cards.name: Place of Power
cards.text: Objective - When an investigator enters Pool of Blood, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Den of Evil
cards.text:
The red glow strengthens as you step down the narrow tunnel until it widens into a spacious cavern. In the center, an enormous pool of blood churns and ripples with growing power. A man in ceremonial robes stretches his arms over the pool, chanting profane words alongside his cronies. "That's him alright," Olive utters, but even her hushed tone alerts the sorcerer. His eyes flash with malice as he recognizes Olive and he raises his hands from the pool. "Ignorant meddlers!" the sorcerer bellows, "You will not prevent our rise to greatness!"
Spawn the set-aside Crimson Wizard at Pool of Blood. Add 1[per_investigator] damage to the scenario reference card.

cards.flavor: As the sorcerers' leader stares you down, Olive scans the room, noting the ritual tools and arcane trappings.  "They're focusing all this power through him!" she exclaims to you, "If we can channel it through us instead, then maybe we can turn their magic back on them!"
cards.name: Redirecting the Locus
cards.text: [action] If you are at Pool of Blood: Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal... - ...a [bless] or [curse] token, ignore it and reveal another token. - ...a 0, +1, or [elder_sign] token, move up to 2 clues controlledby investigators at Pool of Blood to this act. - ...any other numeric token, move 1 clue controlledby an investigator at Pool of Blood to this act. - ...any other symbol token, move 1 clue controlledby an investigator at Pool of Blood to this act, buttake 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one). Objective - If there are 3[per_investigator] or more clues on this act, advance.

cards.name: Volatile Completion
cards.text:
It takes some amount of trial and error to decipher the language of the sorcerers' spell and figure out which parts to edit, but with persistence, you alter the sigils around the pool of blood. With the last change completed, the flow of magic changes visibly, and the great power building within the sorcerers' leader begins to shift. "No!" the wizard cries desperately as energy drains away from him. He has little time to lament as the sudden flux causes an explosion of blood from his body, and he collapses lifelessly onto the edge of the pool.
Move Crimson Wizard to the victory display. (→R4)

cards.flavor: Blood stains the wet soil around the entrance to the cave.
cards.name: Black Cave Entrance
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "We're out of our depth here."

cards.flavor: Black Cave has long been a site of mystery, terror, and grim discovery.  Once again, foul deeds conspire within it.
