[elder_thing]: -3.  If you fail, choose and discard a card from your hand and lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor: Madame Labranche leads you up the rickety steps to her attic, carrying a small oil lamp to light her way.  Immediately, light shines back as it reflects off the enormous heap of coins on the floor, exactly as the elderly woman said.  The muffled silence of the attic is broken only by clinking of falling currency and the creaking of floor-boards... but not just beneath your feet.
cards.name: Thirty Years Gone By
Taketh Away
cards.text:
A faint glow sparks up from various corners around you. With each passing second, you find your material wealth evaporating before your very eyes. You try in vain to hold onto what wealth you can grab, wondering in confusion at how a spell is able to steal your wealth. Madame Labranche simply shakes her head more in bewilderment. "I suppose we'll just have to make due."
Each investigator loses half their resources, rounded up. Any one investigator may exhaust a [[Patron]] asset they control to cancel this effect.

cards.flavor: While the mystery of the vast wealth is a strange enough matter, something is actively trying to stop you from interfering.  Is this Charles' doing, or does some third party have a hand in all this?
cards.name: No Trespassing
Interlopers Begone
cards.text:
The same hostile glow flares up once more, but this time you can feel yourself growing dizzy and unfocused. You brace yourself against a wall while Madame Labranche places a matronly hand on your shoulder, somehow unaffected by the repelling spell.
Each investigator must discard half the cards in their hand at random. Any one investigator may exhaust a [[Patron]] asset they control to cancel this effect.

cards.flavor: The repelling magic set to guard the attic is growing stronger by the moment.  Each step forward is a fight in itself against the steady pressure.  You may be forced out altogether if you don't finish this investigation posthaste.
cards.name: Eviction Notice
Repossession
cards.text:
If it is Act 1 or 2:
The ambient magic continues to build, pressing in on your brain and causing your body to go numb in several places. You're not sure you'll be able to get out at all if you don't leave now, and so you grab Madame Labranche gently but urgently to hurry her back out of the attic.
(→R1)
Otherwise:
The ambient magic continues to build, pressing in on your brain and causing your body to go numb in several places. Unable to carry on, you collapse before the horrid entity. "Enough." The word from the demon's mouth comes quietly and hoarsely, but it leaves tense silence in its wake. "You are no summoner, nor are you my master. In service of the accord I am bound to observe, I shall exact payment. Come forth, my riders!"
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
"I'm afraid that I haven't been up in the attic in years.  Though I'm certain that Charles kept most of his curios here," Madame Labranche muses, "He'd spend hours -- days, even, sequestered up here.  Though I haven't the foggiest notion-"  She stops mid-sentence and peers at the far wall of the attic.  "How very odd...
I don't recall there ever being a door there."  You glance in the same direction to see an aged wooden door, one that in its position should lead to the outside of the house, yet doesn't.
cards.name: Door to the Past
Passage to Beyond
cards.text:
It takes some time rummaging through Charles' belongings before you finally find a tarnished key. An intricate symbol is engraved on the flat handle with the letters S H A X surrounding it. The key fits perfectly within the lock, and you open the door to an impossible and dizzying view. Madame Labranche marvels close behind you, murmuring words of surprise to herself.
Reveal Locked Doorway. Put the set-aside Armory, Lavish Room, Reinforced Room, and Storeroom locations into play. Select one of the set-aside Door Beyond locations at random. Put that location into play, replacing the location that shares its location symbol. Remove the replaced location and each other Door Beyond location from the game.

cards.flavor: It appears that Charles Labranche dabbled in magic to create a doorway to some distant place.  Could the source of the Labranche family fortune lie there?
cards.name: Drawn From History
cards.text: For each of the following that are true, reduce the clue requirement for this act by 1[per_investigator]: The investigators have... - "...found an engraved weapon." - "...noticed the tapestry pattern." - "...studied the wall etchings." - "...discovered a hidden trinket." - "...located the focal point." - "...accepted the gift." Objective - At the end of the round, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: Come Thou Forth
cards.text:
Your search through the realm beyond the door has been fruitful. Substantial wealth is easy to find, and periodically you notice a shift in the piles of coins, no doubt transferring to Madame Labranche's attic. Further scrutiny reveals a series of cleverly hidden sigils, some clear but others worn, smudged, or beginning to deteriorate. Madame Labranche touches one of her temples in thought, looking again over your shoulder. "I'm certain I've seen these symbols before, many years ago, only glancing at one of Charles' books as he read. What was that old tome called again... the Lem... something." "Lemegeton." The quiet, raspy voice sends a shiver down your back, and you whirl around. Staring down at you is a towering figure with a birdlike appearance, flanked by fiery horses. Its attention shifts to Madame Labranche, who returns its stare with shock. "The price thy husband paid be not enough for the riches granted to him. His soul already lies beyond... but yours yet stands before me."
Spawn the set-aside Daemonic Benefactor at the [[Extradimensional]] location with the highest shroud value. Add 4[per_investigator] clues to Ensorcelled Hallway.

cards.flavor: As you defend yourself from the hellish spirit, your mind settles on the bargain Charles Labranche struck with the demon.  If he could do it, then perhaps you could somehow do the same.  You look to Madame Labranche, herself torn between terror and rapidly recalling the past.
cards.name: Renegotiation
cards.text: [action] If you are at the Daemonic Benefactor's location, investigators at your location spend 4 clues as a group: Parley. Reduce the clue cost of this action by 1 if you have no cards in your hand. Reduce the clue cost of this action by 1 if you have no resources in your resource pool. Place 1 clue on Daemonic Benefactor from the token bank. Objective - If there are 1[per_investigator] or more clues on Daemonic Benefactor, advance.

cards.name: Terms of Service
cards.text:
While evading the terrible being, you scour the realm for any indications of how Charles invoked it. Here and there you find scattered details which jog Madame Labranche's memory about her husband's practices. "Often when I would intrude on Charles' studies, there was a triangle drawn on the floor with chalk," she stammers, split between immediate pressure and her usual measured pace. You sort through the inscriptions and patterns, until the elderly woman is able to reproduce a small drawing of the triangle. You rapidly scrawl the design on the floor with whatever you can, the demon once more advancing upon you as you finish. All that remains is to invoke its name... but which name? Your mind races, and you recall the weathered key to the door still in your possession. You hurriedly fish it out of your pocket, noticing once more the design on the handle, with the letters S H A X circling it. Moments from impact, you call out the name 'Shax' and compel it to stand in the triangle. Instantly the demon freezes, and though strained with rage, the raspy voice sounds out once more. "...I hear and obey."
Move Daemonic Benefactor to the victory display. (→R4)

cards.name: Alchemical Study
cards.text: Each [[Enchanted]] or [[Displaced]] enemy at any location gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Each test on an [[Enchanted]] or [[Displaced]] treachery at any location gets +1 difficulty. Forced - When you reveal Alchemical Study: Spawn the set-aside Djinn Servant at Alchemical Study. [action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, remember that you "located the focal point."

cards.flavor:
At the far end of the strange hallway lies a door
nearly identical to the one you entered through.
Glowing letters line the arched frame, mostly in Latin phrases you don't recognize.  However, the name
Jābir ibn Ḥayyān stands noticeably apart from the rest.
cards.name: Door Beyond

cards.flavor: A shimmer of magic keeps flitting at the corner of your eye.  Where is it coming from?
cards.name: Armory
cards.text:
[reaction] After you play a card: Place a resource on Armory from the token bank.
[free] If there are 3[per_investigator] resources on Armory, remember that you "found an engraved weapon."

cards.flavor: What would be an otherwise sturdily locked room is already open, letting you see racks of aged weapons.
cards.name: Armory
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Armory from Ensorcelled Hallway.

cards.flavor: Surely no one will miss a couple of these strange coins.
cards.name: Attic Landing
cards.text: [action]: Resign. "We shouldn't meddle any further." [action]: Gain 2 resources or draw 2 cards (choose one). Remember that you "accepted the gift." (Limit once per round).

cards.flavor: The dimly lit attic is covered with a thin layer of dust, making the heap of glinting coins even more out of place.

Derelict Mineshaft

Forced - When you reveal Derelict Mineshaft: Spawn the set-aside Confederate Ghost at Derelict Mineshaft. [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, remember that you "located the focal point."

cards.flavor:
At the far end of the strange hallway lies a door
nearly identical to the one you entered through.
Glowing letters line the arched frame, mostly in Latin phrases you don't recognize.  However, the name
Free Jim Mine stands noticeably apart from the rest.

cards.flavor:
There could be anything hidden among the random clutter
in this corner of the attic.

[free] Spend 1 resource: Draw a card.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Madame Labranche's attic looks
much larger than it should be.

cards.flavor: Expensive knick-knacks are piled in this side of the attic, requiring careful attention.

cards.text:
While you are investigating this copy of Dusty Attic, it gets +1 shroud for each card in your hand (max +4).
[free] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Gain 1 resource.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Madame Labranche's attic looks
much larger than it should be.

cards.flavor:
Heaps of boxes are piled together here haphazardly,
filled with all sorts of curious objects.
cards.name: Dusty Attic
cards.text:
While you are investigating this copy of Dusty Attic, it gets -1 shroud for every 5 cards in your discard pile (minimum 1).
[free]: Discard the top card of your deck.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
Madame Labranche's attic looks
much larger than it should be.

cards.flavor: Heavy trunks sit next to each other on this side of the attic, sturdily secured with leather straps.
cards.name: Dusty Attic
cards.text: While you are investigating this copy of Dusty Attic, it gets -1 shroud for each non-permanent asset you control (minimum 1).

cards.flavor:
Madame Labranche's attic looks
much larger than it should be.

cards.flavor: Even a brief glance inside gives you a feeling of vertigo.  At the far end of the hallway, the wood paneled wall slowly morphs into something else entirely.
cards.name: Ensorcelled Hallway
cards.text: Forced - After you enter Ensorcelled Hallway: You must choose and discard a card from your hand or lose 1 resource (choose one).

cards.flavor: Predictably, the door is locked.  Despite its age, the door won't budge an inch, and feels sturdier than a brick wall.  Is it even made of wood?
cards.name: Locked Doorway
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Locked Doorway.

cards.flavor: Each piece of art and beautifully is intricately decorated, though some of the patterns do not fit the aesthetic.
cards.name: Lavish Room
cards.text:
[reaction] After you draw X cards: Place X resources on Lavish Room from the token bank.
[free] If there are 5[per_investigator] resources on Lavish Room, remember that you "noticed the tapestry pattern."

cards.flavor:
The opulent designs decorating this door hint at
a comfortable and luxurious interior.
cards.name: Lavish Room
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Lavish Room from Ensorcelled Hallway.

cards.name: Marble Statuary
cards.text: Each [[Enchanted]] or [[Warded]] enemy at any location gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Each test on an [[Enchanted]] or [[Warded]] treachery at any location gets +1 difficulty. cards.flavor:
At the far end of the strange hallway lies a door

While this room's function isn't readily apparent,
it is both heavily braced yet surprisingly detailed.

cards.text:
[reaction] After you spend X resources: Place X resources on Reinforced Room from the token bank.
[free] If there are 5[per_investigator] resources on Reinforced Room, remember that you "studied the wall etchings."

cards.flavor:
It isn't clear what this room is for,
but its door is braced with iron bands.
cards.name: Reinforced Room
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Reinforced Room from Ensorcelled Hallway.

cards.flavor:
Barrels, crates, and unsorted heaps of items lie

cards.text:
[reaction] After you gain X resources: Place X resources on Storeroom from the token bank.
[free] If there are 6[per_investigator] resources on Storeroom, remember that you "discovered a hidden trinket."

cards.flavor: The plain and very well-worn door suggest that this room is frequently traveled, and likely used as storage.
cards.name: Storeroom
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Storeroom from Ensorcelled Hallway.

cards.flavor:

cards.name: Door Beyond
Invocation of Providence
cards.text: [action] Exhaust Invocation of Providence: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from among investigators and [[Ally]]assets at your location.  If you have no resources in your resource pool, heal 1 additional damage.  If you have no cards in your hand, heal 1 additional horror.

cards.name: Labranche Lamen
cards.text:
[reaction] After you play, commit, or discard the last card in your hand, exhaust Labranche Lamen: Gain a resource.
[reaction] After you spend or lose the last resource in your resource pool, exhaust Labranche Lamen: Draw a card.

cards.name: Damned Spirit
cards.text:
Hunter.  Alert.
[reaction] When Damned Spirit attacks you: Instead of taking up to X horror, lose X resources.

cards.name: Dimensional Misalignment
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, put Dimensional Misalignment into play in your threat area. Forced - After you move or are moved: Discard a card from your hand at random. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Dimensional Misalignment.

cards.name: Explosive Sigil
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must (choose one, two instead if you fail by 3 or more): - Take 2 damage. - Lose 2 resources. - Lose 1 action.

cards.name: Fading Secrets
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, place 2 of your clues on your location. For each clue you cannot place, take 1 horror instead.

cards.name: Hidden Mimic
cards.text: Spawn - Location with most clues without another Hidden Mimic. Aloof. Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Hidden Mimic's location: It readies and makes an immediate attack against you. [free] During your turn, place a clue on your location: Engage Hidden Mimic.

cards.name: Homunculus
cards.text: Hunter. Aloof. Forced - When you would commit a card to a test at Homunculus's location: Place that card facedown underneath Homunculus instead. (Max once per test.) Forced - After Homunculus is defeated: Discard each card beneath it.

cards.name: Maddening Sigil
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must (choose one, two instead if you fail by 3 or more): - Take 2 horror. - Choose and discard 2 cards from hand. - Lose 1 action.

cards.name: Mark of Equilibrium
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, put Mark of Equilibrium into play in your threat area. Forced - After you deal damage to an enemy or discover any amount of clues: Lose 2 resources. Forced - At the end of the investigator phase, discard Mark of Equilibrium.

cards.name: Mystic Empowerment
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Mystic Empowerment to a non-[[Elite]] enemy in play. If there are no non-[[Elite]] enemies in play, discard Mystic Empowerment and it gains surge. The attached enemy gets +1 health, +1 damage, and +1 horror. [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand and spend 1 resource: Discard Mystic Empowerment. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Pactbound Nightgaunt
cards.text:
Hunter.
While Pactbound Nightgaunt is engaged with an investigator with 4 or more resources in their resource pool, it gains retaliate.
While Pactbound Nightgaunt is engaged with an investigator with 4 or more cards in their hand, it gains alert.

cards.name: Ready to Spring
cards.text: Revelation - Move each [[Warded]] enemy at a location without investigators directly to the nearest investigator. Put Ready to Spring into play in your threat area. Forced - If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token during a fight or evade action against a [[Warded]] enemy or a test on a [[Warded]] treachery: Treat that token as a [auto_fail] token instead. [action] Place a clue on your location: Discard Ready to Spring.

cards.name: Servile Hound
cards.text: Spawn - Any connecting location. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Servile Hound attacks: Move it to a connecting location.

cards.name: Sudden Ejection
cards.text: Revelation - Move one location toward Attic Landing. If you are not moved by this effect, lose 1 action.

cards.name: Wasting Affliction
cards.text: Revelation - Put Wasting Affliction into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have no cards in your hand or no resources in your resource pool: Take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one). [action] As your first action: Discard Wasting Affliction.

cards.name: Wrested Possession
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, return an [[Item]] or [[Spell]] asset you control to your hand. If you do not control any [[Item]] or [[Spell]] assets, take 2 damage instead.

cards.flavor:
A misfortunate member of a lost regiment,
guarding gold bullion in death as in life.
cards.name: Confederate Ghost
cards.text: Spawn - Derelict Mineshaft. Hunter. Confederate Ghost gets +1 fight and +1 evade while it is not at Derelict Mineshaft.

cards.name: Daemonic Benefactor
cards.text: Hunter. Massive. Forced - When you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token during a test at Daemonic Benefactor's location, if you have "accepted the gift:" Treat that token as a [auto_fail] token instead. Forced - At the start of the upkeep phase, each investigator at Daemonic Benefactor's location must choose: - You cannot draw cards or gain resources this phase. - Daemonic Benefactor makes an immediate attack against you. Objective - If Daemonic Benefactor is defeated, (→R3).

cards.flavor: A spirit of the air, bound to serve the alchemist that transmuted base metals into pure gold.
cards.name: Djinn Servant
cards.text: Spawn - Alchemical Study. Hunter. Djinn Servant gets +1 fight and +1 evade while it is engaged with an investigator with 4 or more cards in their hand.

cards.flavor:
Unlucky in both life and death, this pirate now haunts
the wreck of his ship, still laden with precious cargo.
cards.name: Drowned Pirate
cards.text: Spawn - Sunken Deck. Hunter. Drowned Pirate gets +1 fight and +1 evade while it is engaged with an investigator with 4 or more resources in their resource pool.

cards.flavor:
A marble statue of a Lydian warrior, animated

cards.name: Stone Sentinel
